item.title: Optimized Jekyll site with Grunt
item.description:
Blarg I have started developing static sites with Jekyll in May. For everyone who don’t know what it is:

Jekyll is a simple, blog-aware, static site generator. It takes a template directory containing raw text files in various formats, runs it through a converter (like Markdown) and our Liquid renderer, and spits out a complete, ready-to-publish static website suitable for serving with your favorite web server.

I liked the idea of modules in site project that eventually will generate static website. Furthermore GitHub Pages can generate and host it for you, so you get free hosting and push to deploy ideology.

That’s why it was the perfect choice for Project Zeppelin - free site template for conferences (mostly for GDG DevFest, but for sure you can use it as you want). Unfortunately, there are limitations …
